newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: Jaya Tiasa buys Brazil timber mills.
newsitem.headline: Jaya Tiasa buys Brazil timber mills.

text.p: Malaysia's Jaya Tiasa Holdings Bhd said it has paid $12.1 million for a newly set up Brazilian company which owns a sawmill, a plywood mill and a few parcels of industrial land in Brazil.
The shares of Maginco Verde S.A. were bought through a wholly-owned subsidiary of Jaya Tiasa, the Malaysian timber concern said in a statement issued by its merchant bankers.
Maginco's mills has current production capacity of 5,600 cubic metres of plywood and 1,600 cubic metres of sawntimber a month.
Jaya Tiasa said the investment will provide it with a foothold in the manufacture of forestry products in Brazil and was part of its expansion in the timber industry.
